children.value: Perceptron suffers from the limitation of a linear model: If no separating hyperplane exists, perceptron will NEVER converge. (There will always be some points on the wrong side and it will iterate forever)

It does not generalize well either. Though it corrects all data points correctly, the decision boundary is almost arbitrary. And if a test point is given, Perceptron will very likely to classify it to the wrong side.
